alert.note: Alert for Creek; Okfuskee; Osage; Pawnee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 12 at 2:22PM CST until March 13 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 9 PM CDT SUNDAY FOR VERY DRY AND WINDY CONDITIONS FOR OSAGE...PAWNEE...CREEK...AND OKFUSKEE COUNTIES IN NORTHEAST OKLAHOMA... The National Weather Service in Tulsa has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from noon to 9 PM CDT Sunday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * AFFECTED AREA...IN Oklahoma, Osage, Pawnee, Creek, and Okfuskee counties. * WIND...South to southwest at 15 to 25 mph, gusting to 35 mph. * HUMIDITY...Afternoon humidity falling into the 12 to 18 percent range. * TEMPERATURE...Highs in the mid and upper 60s. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that a dangerous combination of weather conditions and dry vegetation is expected within 24 hours, favoring rapid growth and spread of any wildfires. The primary weather factors include stronger winds, lower humidities, and warmer temperatures.
